solution.text:
\(0 = _{j}_ + _{k}_(p-_{l}_)\)
\(\Rightarrow 0 = _{j}_ + _{k}_p - (_{k}_ \times _{l}_)\) [Using Distributive Law]
\(\Rightarrow 0 = _{j}_ + _{k}_p - _{{k*l}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow -_{j}_ + _{{k*l}}_ = _{k}_p\) [Taking the constant terms to one side]
\(\Rightarrow _{{(k*l)-j}}_ = _{k}_p\)
Dividing both sides by _{k}_, we get:
\(_{{Fraction((k*l)-j,k)}}_ = p\)
